We are extremely glad to announce the launch of GDG New Cairo at GUC online members recruitment. 🙈🎉🎊

If you would like to be a part of GDG's growing community and help spread awaresness about the latest and greates in technology, here is your chance! 🙌🏻

We at GDG strive to put the latest technology into use to develop helpful, useful and entetaining stuff, to maintain a community which is up to date with the current technological scene.

GDG New Cairo at GUC is a subchapter from GDG New Cairo focused on the German University in Cairo community.

You can choose to join our team whichever way you see fit trhough one of the following committees:

The Creative Directory
+ Directory Roles:
- Thinking of good ideas to deliver the knowledge about the latest technologies to the people.
- Coming up with ideas related to event and activities tackling the consumers, and making them understand more about the current technological scene and companies strategies and goals.
- Searching for the latest developers technology and organizing sessions and workshops for it.

Social Media and Marketing Committee
+ Committee Roles:
- Planning on-ground and social media marketing campaigns for     the club’s activities and events.
- Administering the club’s social media accounts.
- Doing SWOT analysis on a regular basis, with a marketing segmentation report.
- Creating advertising plans for the club’s overall image, on-campus, off-campus, and on social media.
- Maintaining the image, identity, and branding of the club through creative ideas.

Public Relations Committee
+ Committee Roles:
- Organising the “Marketing and Advertising” on-ground campaigns, incoordination with them.
- Organising the “Fundraising and Sponsorships” fundraising events on campus, incoordination with them. 
- Participating in implementing the “Build Cool Stuff” activities and events, incoordination with them.
- Responsible for the internal and external relations of the club, with other organisations, clubs, and groups.
- Creating partnerships with other organisations or groups that will benefit the club.
- Responsible for the approvals and permissions with the university administration.

People Operations Committee
+ Committee Roles:
- Evaluating the members through an evaluation system.
-Regular documentations of the events and progress, through reports and surveys.
- Updating the members with the latest news.
- Motivating the members and developing techniques to increase their commitment.
- Responsible for the development process of the members through sessions, trainers, and workshops in coordination.    
- Maintaining our fun and cool culture in the club.

Illustrations Committee
+ Committee Roles:
- Responsible for the branding theme and identity of the club.
- Designing various graphic designs for our activities, events, items, and campaigns.
- Responsible for the artistic touch in the club.

Media Committee
+ Committee Roles:
- Responsible for the branding theme and identity of the club.
- Responsible for all the photography and videography (video 
editing) of the club.
- Covering all of our various activities and events in terms of photography and videography.

Fundraising and Sponsorships
+ Committee Roles:
- Responsible for the funding resources of the club through making deals and offers with various companies to be our sponsors.
- Brainstorming and planning for fundraising events on campus.
- Coordinating with “Public Relations and Communications” on hosting the fundraising events on campus.
- Creating the club's benefit package to be delivered to our future sponsors when contacting them.
- Determining any financial issues inside the chapter, and the ways to overcome it.
- Creating a database of contacts regarding sponsors.

Logistics and Coordination
+ Committee Roles:
- Buying all the required materials needed for our activities and events, with the reasonable quality and price.
- Brainstorming and implementing the annual club package for the members, alongside any package required for any activity or event.
- Responsible for the implementation of the club's booths.
- Creating a database of contacts regarding suppliers and printing centers

Think you could come up with a way to optimize the layout of a Google data center? Or how about routing Google Street View cars through a busy city?  

Step into the shoes of a Google engineer and tackle similar challenges during Hash Code (g.co/hashcode), a team-based programming competition for students and professionals (18+) across Europe, the Middle East and Africa organized by Google. You pick your team and programming language, we pick a real-life engineering problem to solve. Are you up for the challenge?

The competition is divided into two stages:

Online Qualification Round
23rd February 2017, 18:30 - 22:30 CET
For this round, your team can participate from wherever you’d like, including one of our Hash Code hubs. Hubs allow for teams in the same location (eg. city or university) to compete side-by-side in a more fun and exciting environment.

Final Round
1st April 2017
Top scoring teams from the Online Qualification Round will be invited to Google Paris to compete in the Final Round of the competition.

Registration is now open at g.co/hashcode.

Being an entrepreneur is a never ending process of exposing oneself to new experiences. With each new experience, a new side is realized within oneself. And since a side that Canvas GUC is very committed to unraveling in its community is the entrepreneurial one, Canvas is hereby proudly announcing the return of last year’s “Unravel your entrepreneurial side”.

Join us in Canvas’s second event of its type which will be an upgrade to last year’s. With an evolved experience this year, you’ll be truly witnessing entrepreneurship from the views of some of the entrepreneurs who made it. Our group of honorable guests is a diverse one from lots of different entrepreneurial paths that will relate to the audience’s different walks of life.

We’ll discuss several topics over the entrepreneurial sphere, from funding a startup to technology trends to even what would make entrepreneurship a bad option. And as we have mentioned our high regard to new experiences, be ready for a diverse event with some activities to involve you in the startup scene and a special emphasis on personal exposure to what it’s like to be an entrepreneur. Sounds a little intense to you? Don’t worry, because there’ll be a break in the middle to grab a bite.

Egypt National Cyber Security CTF is a cyber security competition where participants demonstrate their technical ability. The Competition provides the highest cash prizes for the winning teams.
Egypt National Cyber Security  CTF winners are eligible to compete in regional and international CTFs representing Egypt. The CTF will be a  Jeopardy Style CTF where every team will have a list of challenges in different categories like Reverse Engineering, Web Security, Digital Forensics, Network Security and others. For every challenge solved, the team will get a certain amount of points depending on the difficulty of the challenge. The team who will get the highest score at the end of the day will be the winning team.

Prizes
Winning Team will get 100,000 EGP as Cash prize 
1st Runner up will get 30,000 EGP  as Cash prize
2nd Runner up will get 20,000 EGP  as Cash prize.
All winning teams will receive medals
All teams will get CyberTalents T-shirts
Four to five members from the First three teams will have an opportunity to be selected by CyberTalents to represent Egypt in an international CTF Competition in Japan in November 2017.

Registration 

Registration is available on Cybertalents.com to practice on existing challenges. New challenges will be added every week on the portal to practice.
Qualification Round is per individual not per team.
Teams Formation will open after the qualification round starting from  10th of April 
Join our slack channel 
https://cybertalents-ctfs.slack.com/shared_invite/MTQ3MDkyNTM1NjIyLTE0ODgwMDc2NjUtMGJjMTlhZjA0MA

Teams 
Number of Team members:  Minimum two - Maximum three members with the below conditions :
At least two members of the team must be undergraduates in any Egyptian university or school.
One Mentor is allowed to join the team , the mentor is a professional working in cyber security field that can provides technical mentorship to his/her team before and during the CTF. ( Mentors are allowed to be one of the team during the competition)
Every Team should have a team leader, that is responsible to build the team and he will be the main contact to the organizers.
Moving members between teams is allowed two days before the competition
Mentors or undergraduates team players can’t be a member of multiple teams
Although we prefer that undergraduates represent their universities but there is no restrictions on having members from different universities at the same team 
Teams coming from outside cairo will get reimbursement for their travel expenses and one night accommodation after delivering the bills to organizers with a maximum of 300 EGP / person

Venue : TBD, Cairo

CyberTalents is a platform that ranks  cyber security talents according to their real hands on skills in different cyber security categories in order to get hired by recruiters. Cyber Talents provides recruitment & personnel assessment to its customers in a SAAS model

الكورس هيكون مع: Nour El Refai
محتويات الكورس:
Day 1
Duration : 3 Hours
Perception, Lines, and Angles
Lighting Techniques
Shoot preparation and gear
The presentation is divided into two parts: 1- A theoretical part regarding perception
and how to think about angles. 2- Explaining all the gear used, from camera settings to
lighting techniques, and how to prepare for a photo shoot.

Day 2
Duration: 5 Hours
Shooting in an Interior Showroom, Participants will get the chance to shoot along with Nour, practice with angles, and apply different lighting techniques.

Day 3
Duration: 3 Hours
Workflow and Post-processing
Explaining and practicing with the culling and editing process of the photos.
Requirements:
Laptop, with Lightroom and Photoshop.

Day 4
Duration: 3 Hours
Selection and Critique
Critique and remarks on the final photos from the participant's work. Talking about the
strength and weakness of each photo, and discussing how to improve the final product.

Requirements:
. DSLR Camera
. Laptop, and tethering cable
. Tripod
. Wide angle lens (ex. Nikon 14-24mm or Canon 11-24mm on a full frame body, or equiv. focal length on APS-C body.
(You can rent lenses and cameras)
. Basics photography background (know how to use the camera + settings)

Instructor Bio:
Nour El Refai (b. 1983 - Cairo, Egypt).  
obtained a degree in Architecture at Cairo University and has been working as an Architectural photographer since 2005.
He has covered documentary stories and assignments in Egypt, Morocco, Algeria, India, and Turkey. His work has been published in the Financial Times, The Huffington Post and many more.
He taught architecture photography at various Egyptian universities and continues to teach workshops in his Studio.

اجتماع صلاه: Return to the roots of beauty with AID...Nubia and Abu Simbel adventure (mid-year trip 2014/2015)
column2:
After the finals week we need to ease our minds in mid-year vacation .. Why don't you join AID GUC in this adventure ^_^ ? This unconventional journey will take us to explore the heart of upper Egypt, The lost kingdom of Nubia.

A visit to the Nubian lands gets you in touch with their unique culture. Nubians are very proud of their culture as they speak their own language, have their own traditions, music and food and that's why it managed to remain very well preserved along the decades.

Enjoy 4 days / 3 nights of the clear blue water of the Nile, the shining laughs of the Nubian kids and nothing between you and the pure Egyptian nature.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Highlights:

Duration: 4 Days / 3 Nights

Accommodation:
- Staying in Hotel Anakato Nubian Houses (in Nubia) (in triple rooms)
- Staying in Hotel Seti first Abu simbel (in Aswan) (in double rooms)

Domestic Transportation: Felucca & A/C Bus. 

Sightseeing:
- Exploring the Nubian Village and the unique culture of its people.
- Visiting the peaceful village of Heissa
- Visiting Philae Temple on Agilika Island 
- Visiting the Nubian museum and unfinished obelisk
- Visiting the museum of Asmbouzayom
- Visiting Abu simbel Temple 
- The Nubian Party with a BBQ dinner
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Day 1 (17/1/2015) "Welcome to The Lost Kingdom"

Arrival in Aswan then having breakfast in Anakato hotel from 9 to 10, then from 10 to 1:30 there will be time to have rest and unpack your bags. At 2 we will move by a boat to visit the Nature reserves and Anakato beach we will have some time to drink tea and coffee in Barbar café on the nile then we will take the boat back to Bait el 7aga loza to enjoy the beautiful Nubian food and fruits there will be time to take pictures with the little crocodiles and draw 7ena at 7 we will be back to the hotel.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Day 2 (18/1/2015) "Exploring The Lost Kingdom"

Breakfast from 9 to 10 then moving at 10.30 with buses to visit the Nubian museum with the tour guides and the unfinished obelisk, at 1.30 we will be back to the hotel to change clothes and rest for some time at 4 to visit the museum of Asmbouzayom and Temple of Philae will move to the temple by boats to attend the Sound and Light Show. At 8 we’ll move to have open buffet dinner in porto sono on the nile. We will be back to the hotel at 10.30
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Day 3 (19/1/2015) "A day in Aswan:Visiting Abu simbel"

Breakfast will be from 9 to 10 then we will pack our bags and move at 11 by buses to Abu Simbel we will arrive at 2. We will spend some time in Seti first hotel in front of naser’s lake. At 4 we will move to Abu Simbel temple we will attend the sound and light show there and then we will have open buffet dinner in Eskaliih and we will enjoy an hour of Oud music then we will be back to the hotel.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Day 4 (20/1/2015) "Farewell party on the Nubian way!"

Breakfast in Seti first and then we will take the buses to Anakato we will arrive at 2 then will take the boats to the Aswan’s market so you can buy souvenirs after that we will have a Nubian party with barbeque and at 8 we will take the buses back to the train/airport
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Erstes InnenHofkonzert am 3. Mai im Tierheim Hof

Am Donnerstag, den 3. Mai gehen sie wieder los – die InnenHofKonzerte. Im parkähnlichen Eingangsbereich des Tierheims Hof erwartet die Besucher der urige Oberkrainersound der „Frankenkrainer“. Die Musiker, die schon seit über 30 Jahren auf Festen wie dem Schlappentag oder dem Hofer Volksfest aufspielen, sind weit über die Region hinaus bekannt.
„Back to the Roots“ lautet ihr Motto in der neuen Formation und man darf sich auf 5 Herzblut-Musiker freuen, die auch die InnenHofKonzerte wieder zu ihren Wurzeln zurückführen: Ein schöner Gartenhof, unverstärkte Musik und selbstgemachte Brotzeiten.

Für Letztere sorgen die ehrenamtlichen Mitarbeiter des Tierheims und Tierschutzvereins Hof und die Metzgerei Strobel aus Dörnthal. Bratwürste vom Strohschwein, Steaks und auch selbstgemachte vegetarische und vegane Snacks umfasst das Angebot. Natürlich sind auch die Brauerei Scherdel und die Weinhandlung Kretschmann als jahrelange InnenHofKonzert-Sponsoren wieder mit im Boot.

Alle Ausgestalter des Konzerts, angefangen von den Musikanten bis hin zum Catering, verzichten zugunsten des Tierheims auf Gagen und Berechnungen. Im Namen des Tierheims und des Stadtmarketing Hof e.V. ergeht an dieser Stelle ein herzliches Dankeschön!

Bitcoin, Ethereum, zCash, Ripple, Dash, OmiseGo, Dfinity... the list goes on and on. All these  systems share two things: a chain of blocks of data replicated across thousands of computers all over the world that don't trust one another, and a load of controversy about their existence. "Blockchain" is a new buzz word used to describe decentralized ecosystems designed to be operated trustlessly by  participants in their networks. In this talk, I'll present you with a high-level overview of the technology and its implications for our present day-to-day lives, and debunk some of the myths and false promises circulating.

Duration: 1h 30m (40m + 10m break + 40m)
Speaker: Rami Khalil; GUC Alumnus and Master Student at Imperial college.

The first part will not require a technical background, and will be appropriate for anyone interested from any field. The second part will require familiarity with the capabilities of basic encryption and a working understanding of database systems and computer network communication (MET/DMET/B-INFK 6+).

The SD & G CoE in ITI is proud to host the Global Game Jam (GGJ) under the activities of the IGDA Egypt Chapter for the 6th time this year.  
This year; we will be honored by the presence of “Mrs. Susan Gold”, the Founder and President of the Global Game Jam (GGJ).

For 5 Consecutive years, ITI’s site has been ranked as the largest site with the “most participants in a game jam (single location)” and last year we were awarded a Guinness World Record for that. 

What is Global Game Jam 2018?
o	The GGJ is the world's largest game jam event taking place around the world at physical locations. It’s a hackathon focused on game development. It’s a space where talented individuals, get together to work in a fun and intense atmosphere of creativity and experimentation throughout a 48 hour period. The Game Jam is more like an “idea space” rather than competition. It stimulates collaboration and encourages people with all kinds of backgrounds to participate and contribute to this global spread of game development and creativity.

In last years’ Global Game Jam, there were more than 1,000+ participants from all over Egypt. Throughout the weekend around 70 games have been developed and uploaded. 
Through out the jams, Winners got prizes varying from smart devices to free licenses; As well as; benefits for the rest of the Jammers on site.

When is GGJ?
o	Global Game Jam will take place on 26th - 28th January 2018

o	Smart Village – ITI B148

o	There will be multiple introductory sessions regarding to Game development, Art and Design in the first day

Is the venue open all the time during GGJ18? 
o	Yes the venue will be open starting from 8:00 AM every day in GGJ18 till the end of the GGJ day 

What is the GGJ age policy for attending?
To participate in the Global Game Jam event, you must be a legal adult (have a valid National ID)
No person may participate in a Global Game Jam event® unless they have reached 16 years of age or older to participate and attend.
All jammers under 16 years of age, must be accompanied by one of their parents at all times while attending the jam. http://globalgamejam.org/code-conduct-legal-policies 

Is sleeping over allowed? And what are the requirements for that?
o	Yes for the 26-27 January. The only requirement is the photocopy of your National ID.

Is there secure storage for my belongings?
o	No, every person will be responsible for his own stuff

Is there any food provided?
o	Access to coffee/beverages and food in close vicinity for most of the day.

Are there any requirements for attending the Event?

http://egyptgamejam.com/ and then click “Join this Jam Site” Button

 ده شرح كل واحده من الفقرات اللي هناخدك فيها خلال اليوم D: 
1- Empirical tent 
 ال empirical tent هتكون عباره عن  خمس محطات  فيهم تجارب كتير في الكيميا والميكانيكا وتجارب بتشرح طبيعة الرعد وازاي الخداع البصري بيحصل وتجارب تانية هتخلى العلم بالنسبالك امتع ، و هتفهم حاجات كانت محيراك وقت طويل ;) 
******************************************************************************
 2- Wonderland of science
دي عباره عن ممر فيه 8 محطات, كل محطه بتدخل في عالم مختلف, بديكورات ومؤثرات بتعيشك جوا الفكره اللي المحطه بتشرحها وبتتكلم عنها, مش بس هتكون عن العلم لكن كمان في محطات فيها هتوريك الجانب العلمي لحاجات بتتعرضلها كل يوم, زي مثلا ليه عقلك بيحب المزيكا؟؟ ومحطات تانيه هتشرحلك اسئله أعمق زي مثلا "الكون بدأ ازاى؟؟ وايه النظريات اللي البشر حطوها علي مر التاريخ لحد النهارده...طب هل فيها حاجات مش منطقيه؟؟  ولا اصلا في اجابه معروفه للسؤال ده ؟؟  ده كله هتعرفه في المحطه دي, باقي المحطات هتعرفها لما تنورنا في الفيستفال :)

ايه رايك في التكييف؟ اختراع مش كده؟ التكييف بيقدر يظبط درجة الحرارة زي ما انت عايز لوحده، يعني بيشوف درجة حرارة الاوضة بعد كده يحدد اذا كان مفروض يشتغل تبريد ولا تسخين. جوا التكييف ده كمبيوتر صغير، او Microcontroller باستخدام الكمبيوتر الصغير ده تقدر تبرمج اي حاجة حواليك عشان تبقي Automated يعني شغالة اتوماتيك )توماتيكي توماتيكي(. ال Arduino هوا واحد من اشهر البوردات الي بتستخدم ال microcontrollers و تقدر تبرمجه بسهولة عشان تتحكم في اي حاجة حواليك. في الورشة دي، هتتعلم يعني ايه Microcontroller و ازاي تقدر توصل عليه الcomponents بتاعتك و ازاي تقدر تبرمجه عشان يتحكم في المشروع بتاعك، مش بس كده انت كمان هتقدر تطبق امثلة كتيرة بنفسك.

What do you think about your AC? Magnificent, right ? your AC can adjust the temperature as you like, it measures the room temperature and decide whether to cool down or heat up. Inside your AC there’s a small computer, called a Microcontroller. Microcontrollers are used to program any device to be automated, Arduino is one of the most popular boards the use microcontrollers to control electronic circuits.
In this workshop, you’ll learn what’s microcontrollers, and how to connect your components to the Arduino board and program it to control your project.

تستهدف الورشة المبتدئين و طلاب الفنون والمهتمين، تهدف في الأساس إلى تعلم كيفية البحث في طرق التفكير ولا تهدف إلى تعلم تقنيات الرسم والتصوير.

تُقام الورشة في مدرار من الأحد ٨ مايو ٢٠١٦ إلى الأحد ٢٢ مايو ٢٠١٦
٧ محاضرات، الأحد والثلاثاء والخميس من كل أسبوع، الساعة ٤ عصراً.
يليها معرض ثلاث أيام لنتاج الورشة.

البرنامج:
المحاضرة الاولى: طبيعة صامتة - تدريبات  (٥ ساعات)

المحاضرة التانية: محاضرة مع فنان ضيف للورشة عن الصياغة وإعادة الصياغة و
علاقة التقنية بالفكرة (٣ ساعات )

المحاضرة التالتة: تجميع مواد لعمل لوحات بشكل ارتجالي (٥ ساعات)

المحاضرة الرابعة: تحديد موضوع للعمل والمناقشة (٥ ساعات )

المحاضرة الخامسة: محاضرة مفتوحة لمجموعة من الفنانين عن الاقتباس والسرقة والتقليد واعادة الصياغة وكيفية الكتابة عن المشروع الفني بأكثر من مفهوم (٣ ساعات )

المحاضرة السادسة: تجهيز خطة لمشروع شخصي والعمل على تطويره

المحاضرة السابعة: تنفيذ المشروع
رسوم الورشة: ٥٠٠ جنية، تُسدد في مقر مدرار قبل بدء الورشة .

للتقدم بطلب المشاركة، يرجى ملئ استمارة الاشتراك أدناه وإرسالها قبل الأحد ٢٢ أبريل ٢٠١٦ .. ويتم إخطار المشاركين الذين تم اختيارهم فقط في موعد أقصاه الخميس ٢٨ أبريل ٢٠١٦.

نبذة عن المدرب :
أحمد  صبري - رسام ومصور ومحرك رسوم، ولد في ١٩٨٢، تخرج من كلية التربية الفنية جامعة حلوان ٢٠٠٤، يعمل ويعيش بالقاهرة، يهتم منذ ٢٠٠٧ بالصورة التليفزيونية والاعلامية كمصدر بصري ومفاهيمي، يشارك بالحركة الفنية منذ ٢٠٠٢ وآخر مشاركاته مهرجان D-caf ٢٠١٦ بمصر، أقام العديد من الورش الفنية مثل ورشة الرسوم المتحركة داخل برنامج الورش التجريبية لفنون الميديا بكلية التربية الفنية ومؤسسة اسكي من ٢٠٠٧وحتى ٢٠١٥، وورش فنية للرسم والتصوير بجاليري سوما آرت بالزمالك ومكان الفنون بالمعادي ٢٠١٦.

MakerHackathon هي اول مسابقة هاردوير في مصر بينظمها Dimensions Student Organizationعبارة عن تلات ايام تبدأ فيهم مشروعك انت والتيم بتاعك وتقدر تحول فكرتك لنموذج اولي او نهائي علي ارض الواقع 

- امتيMaker Hackathon ؟ وفين؟

MakerHackathon السنادي هيكون في  ITI (Information Technology Institute) في القرية الذكية      وهيكون في 2 و 3 و 4 فبراير.

وخلال الثلاث ايام هنوفرلك كل ال Hardware tools الي ممكن تحتاجها من ابسط حاجة ولحد ال Laser Cutters &     3D printers غير كل الembedded systems زي الArduino  و الAVR والRasperry pie 
غير ان هيكون معك mentors متخصصين هيساعدوك في اي مشكلة ممكن تواجهك في تحقيق فكرتك .
وفي اليوم الثالث هيكون كل فريق قدر انه ينفذ نموذج اولي او نهائي من المنتج وهيتم عرضه في نهاية اليوم علي لجنة تحكيم من شركات مختلفة لاختيار افضل الفرق للفوز

لو عندك فكرة وفريق عمل ينفذها يبقي شيء ممتاز

لو إنت متخصص في مجال معين زي التصميم الصناعي أو البرمجة لكن مفيش فكرة معينة في دماغك وحابب تشارك، ممكن تنضم مع فريق عمل بتخصصك وتساهم في تنفيذ الفكرة :)

The Business & Entrepreneurship Support Department is launching the BEST Program stands for Business & Entrepreneurship Support Training Program. This Program is going to present different trainings and workshops for the startups throughout the whole year.

Under the BEST Program, BES Department at TIEC is holding Android Mobile Development Training for three consecutive days from Tuesday 26th to Thursday 28th January from 9:00 AM to 3:00 PM. at TIEC, B5 Smart Village, Room 112.

Interested in learning how to make Android apps?
Learn our Android programming for Beginner, Intermediate Android Programmers. Android training course is designed to quickly get you up to speed how to make Android apps for Android devices. This will teach you the basis of the Android platform and the application lifecycle. You will be able to write simple GUI applications, use built-in widgets and components, work with the database to store data locally, and much more by the end of this Android training course.

The Training will highlight the following areas in Android:
Android Stack and SDK Overview.
Hello World Program - Environment Initialization.
Activity Life cycle.
Activity and Fragments.
Intents.
Workshop.
Android User Interface.
Advanced UI components.
Layouts manager.
Menus.
Dialog and Toas Workshop.
File I/O.
Shared Preferences.
SQL_lite Database.
Lists.
Networking & Maps.

We're excited to share with you Egypt's truly life changing adventure line designed and led by Galal Zekri Chatila! After touring 7000 kms across Egypt on his bicycle, Galal decided to share the beauty he found with the adventurers out there! There is much to be done in Egypt and we want to explore all that with you! Our trips are designed for you to see Egypt in a new way, sometimes even see uninhibited places!

We're going Kayaking in Fayoum!

For information call us on 0106 040 0070

Day 1: (L/D)
We’ll meet at the Wild Guanabana Headquarters and take a bus ride, we'll be dropped off by the bus at the waterfalls of the Rayan Southern Lake. After a scenic hike to the lake, you will be given a briefing on kayaking, safety rules and packing. You’ll then kayak the 6.6 kilometers down to Camp 1, during which you have the opportunity eat lunch in the middle of the lake, quite a remarkable experience! After a brief rest at Camp 1, you will then prepare your dinner, followed by stargazing, sharing stories and perhaps playing some board games.  

Day 2: (B/L/D)
Today, you’ll wake up to an early breakfast to fuel up for 12 kilometers of kayaking! If we’re lucky, we’ll be able to see the flamingos and kayak to the sound of birds. We can pause for some birdwatching!  Once again, we’ll have a mid-lake lunch, this time on an island! After the kayaking, we will hike 3 km to Camp 2 where you will rinse off the salt and begin preparing your dinner. Tonight, you’ll eat enjoying the quaint and beauty of the dessert life.

Day 3: (B/L)
After breakfast, you’ll hike a 4-kilometer path to the buses that will transport you to the village of Tunis for lunch. You’ll get to witness a wide view of Lake Qarun, a salt-water remnant of an ancient freshwater lake. While in the village you’ll also have the opportunity to check out local pottery shops and get a few souvenirs. Buses leave for Cairo by 2 pm. 

You can check the detailed itinerary here: http://www.wildguanabana.com/trips/kayaking-in-fayoum
---

Price includes (EGP 1500):

•      This price is based on 13 participants
•      Accommodation (Tents)
•      All activities as mentioned above
•      All meals as mentioned above (B= Breakfast, L=          Lunch, D= Dinner)
•      Round trip from Cairo to Fayoum
•      Program design 
•      First Aid trained local guides and camp crew 
•      Permits when needed
•      Experienced English speaking guide

Price excludes:

•	Personal items

---
Guidelines and Emergency:

•	You are here to enjoy the nature, not to harm it.
•	Please take nothing but pictures, and leave nothing but  your awesome vibe. 
•	Our WG journeys are tracked, the group’s movement is lively updated to our headquarters; and we will always take the move in time in case of any emergency.
•	If you need to call your family at any point when we are off the grid; the minute over our satellite connection is for 20 EGP.

Safety rules:

•	All the adventurers participating in our journeys have to follow our WG leader.
•	You must wear the protective gear including the life jacket
•	Always try as much as you can to walk in pairs.
•	Never put your hand in a bush, or try to move the rocks; reptiles love these places. 
•	Try to always stay close to the group so that you can avoid getting lost. 
•	Never panic, our WG leader is well experienced to handle the situation
•	Always stay close to the group and to our WG leader; always inform any of your group mates if nature calls.
